revised_title: Facilitation of Sodium Currents in Frog Neuroglia by Nerve Impulses
tldr: The authors discovered that nerve impulses can facilitate sodium currents in frog neuroglia, and this facilitation is dependent on external calcium levels. They used patch-clamp techniques to study the relationship between nerve impulses and glial voltage-dependent sodium currents, providing insights into neuron-glia interactions and the role of glial cells in the nervous system.
